opendial.bn.distribs

Class ConditionalTable

  • java.lang.Object
    • opendial.bn.distribs.ConditionalDistribution<CategoricalTable>
      • opendial.bn.distribs.ConditionalTable
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ProbDistribution

    public class ConditionalTable
extends ConditionalDistribution<CategoricalTable>
    Traditional probability distribution represented as a discrete probability table. The table expresses a generic distribution of type P(X | Y1, ..., Yn), where X is called the "head" random variable, and Y1, ..., Yn the conditional random variables.

    Technically, the table is expressed as a double mapping, where each assignment for Y1, ..., Yn is mapped to a categorical table where the assignments for X are associated with a given probability value.

    Author:
    Pierre Lison (plison@ifi.uio.no)

    • Method Detail

      • addRow

        public void addRow(Assignment condition,
                   Value head,
                   double prob)
        Adds a new row to the probability table, given the conditional assignment, the head assignment and the probability value. If the table already contains a probability, it is erased.
        Parameters:
        condition - the conditional assignment for Y1...Yn
        head - the value for the head variable
        prob - the associated probability

      • addRow

        public void addRow(Assignment condition,
                   java.lang.String head,
                   double prob)
        Adds a new row to the probability table, given the conditional assignment, the head assignment and the probability value. If the table already contains a probability, it is erased.
        Parameters:
        condition - the conditional assignment for Y1...Yn
        head - the value for the head variable (as a string)
        prob - the associated probability

        head - the value for the head variable (as a double)

      • addRow

        public void addRow(Assignment condition,
                   boolean head,
                   double prob)
        Adds a new row to the probability table, given the conditional assignment, the head assignment and the probability value. If the table already contains a probability, it is erased.
        Parameters:
        condition - the conditional assignment for Y1...Yn
        head - the value for the head variable (as a boolean)
        prob - the associated probability

      • incrementRow

        public void incrementRow(Assignment condition,
                         Value head,
                         double prob)
        Increments the probability specified in the table for the given condition and head assignments. If none exists, simply assign the probability.
        Parameters:
        condition - the conditional assignment
        head - the head assignment
        prob - the probability increment

      • addRows

        public void addRows(Assignment condition,
                    CategoricalTable heads)
        Add a new set of rows to the probability table, given the conditional assignment and the mappings (head assignment, probability value).
        Parameters:
        condition - the conditional assignment for Y1...Yn
        heads - the simple table with (head assignment, probability value)

      • addRows

        public void addRows(java.util.Map<Assignment,java.util.Map<Value,java.lang.Double>> fullTable)
        Add a new set of rows to the probability table, given the mapping between conditional assignments and (value assignment, prob) pairs
        Parameters:
        fullTable - the full probability table to insert

      • removeRow

        public void removeRow(Assignment condition,
                      Value head)
        Removes a row from the table, given the condition and the head assignments.
        Parameters:
        condition - conditional assignment
        head - head assignment

      • fillConditionalHoles

        public void fillConditionalHoles()
        Fill the "conditional holes" of the distribution -- that is, the possible conditional assignments Y1,..., Yn that are not associated with any distribution P(X1,...,Xn | Y1,...,Yn) in the table. The method create a default assignment X1=None,... Xn=None with probability 1.0 for these cases.

      • getProb

        public double getProb(Assignment condition,
                      Value head)
        Returns the probability P(head|condition), if any is specified. Else, returns 0.0f.
        Specified by:
        getProb in interface ProbDistribution
        Overrides:
        getProb in class ConditionalDistribution<CategoricalTable>
        Parameters:
        condition - the conditional assignment
        head - the head assignment
        Returns:
        the associated probability, if one exists.

      • getMarginalProb

        public double getMarginalProb(Value head)
        Returns the probability P(head). If the specified distribution contains conditional variables, they are marginalised.
        Parameters:
        head - the head assignment
        Returns:
        the associated probability, if one exists.

      • hasProb

        public boolean hasProb(Assignment condition,
                       Value head)
        Returns whether the distribution has a well-defined probability for the given conditional and head assignments
        Parameters:
        condition - the conditional assignment
        head - the head assignment
        Returns:
        true if the distribution defines a probability for the value, and false otherwise

      • hasProbTable

        public boolean hasProbTable(Assignment condition)
        Returns true if the table contains a distribution for the given assignment of conditional variables, and false otherwise
        Parameters:
        condition - the conditional assignment
        Returns:
        true if the table contains a distribution, false otherwise

      • getFlatTable

        public java.util.Map<Assignment,java.lang.Double> getFlatTable()
        Returns a flat table mapping complete variable assignments (for both the conditional and the head variables) to a probability value.

        This flat table corresponds to the "factor matrix" structure used in e.g. variable elimination.

        Returns:
        the flattened probability table

      • getPosterior

        public ProbDistribution getPosterior(Assignment condition)
                              throws java.lang.RuntimeException
        Returns the posterior distribution obtained by integrating the (possibly partial) conditional assignment.
        Specified by:
        getPosterior in interface ProbDistribution
        Overrides:
        getPosterior in class ConditionalDistribution<CategoricalTable>
        Parameters:
        condition - assignment on a subset of the conditional variables
        Returns:
        the resulting probability distribution.
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if the posterior could not be computed.

      • isDeterministic

        public boolean isDeterministic()
        Returns true if the conditional distribution is deterministic, i.e. each condition is associated with a distribution with a single possible value (with probability 1.0).
        Returns:
        true if the distribution is deterministic, false otherwise

      • getDeterministic

        public ConditionalDistribution<SingleValueDistribution> getDeterministic()
        Returns a deterministic distribution where each "head" distribution is reduced to a distribution with a single possible value (with probability 1.0).
        Returns:
        the deterministic equivalent of the distribution
